docs.summary: Events that are fired from a Wix Store.
description: Wix Stores events are fired in your site's backend when certain events occur in your site's store.
You can write event handlers that react to these events. Event handler functions
receive data that corresponds to the event that has occurred. Use event handlers
to create custom responses to store events.
To add a store event handler, add an **events.js** file to the **Backend** section
of your site if one does not already exist. All event handler functions for your
site are defined in this file.
Event handler functions are defined using the following pattern:
```javascript
export function <wixAppName>_<eventName>(event) { }
For example, an event handler that handles cart abandonment in a Wix Store looks
like this:
```javascript
export function wixStores_onCartAbandoned(event) { }
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the cart that was abandoned.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a visitor abandons a shopping cart.
description: The `onCartAbandoned()` event handler runs when a visitor adds an item to the
shopping cart, but does not complete the purchase within 1 hour.
If the visitor completes the purchase after it has been abandoned, an
[`onCartRecovered`](#onCartRecovered) event is fired.
You can use this event to reach out to the visitor who abandoned the shopping cart.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event when a shopping cart is abandoned
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the cart that was completed.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a visitor completes a purchase from a shopping cart.
description: The `onCartCompleted()` event handler runs when a visitor completes a
purchase from a shopping cart.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event with pickup details when a shopping cart is completed
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
*    "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*       "address": "235 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA"
*         "address": "235 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA"

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the cart that was created.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a cart is created.
description: The `onCartCreated()` event handler runs the first time a site visitor adds a product to their shopping cart.
Removing all items from the cart and adding a new item does not create a new cart and does not trigger this event.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event when a shopping cart is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the cart that was recovered.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a visitor completes a purchase from an abandoned shopping cart.
description: The `onCartRecovered()` event handler runs when a visitor completes a purchase
more than 1 hour after items have been added to a shopping cart.
You can use this event to cancel planned communications with the visitor who abandoned the shopping cart.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

body: // Place this code in the events.js file

docs.summary: An event that fires when an order fulfillment is created.
description: The `onFulfillmentCreated()` event handler runs when one of the following occurs:
+ The [createFulfillment()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-stores-backend/createfulfillment) function is called.
+ A [tracking number](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-a-tracking-number-to-a-store-order) is added to an order.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event when a fulfillment is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about a fulfillment that was deleted.

docs.summary: An event that fires when an order fulfillment is deleted.
description: The `onFulfillmentDeleted()` event handler runs when the [deleteFulfillment()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-stores-backend/deletefulfillment) function is called.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about a fulfillment that was updated.

docs.summary: An event that fires when an order fulfillment is updated.
description: The `onFulfillmentUpdated()` event handler runs when one of the following occurs:
+ The [updateFulfillment()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-stores-backend/updatefulfillment) function is called.
+ A [tracking number](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-a-tracking-number-to-a-store-order) on an order is edited.
> **Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

object contains information about the new order that was placed.

docs.summary: An object representing fulfillment information that was created.

examples.title: An event when a fulfillment is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

members.name: orderId
members.doc: ID of the order the fulfillment was created for.

members.name: fulfillmentId
members.doc: ID of the fulfillment that was created.

members.name: dateCreated
members.doc: Date and time the fulfillment was created.

members.name: buyerInfo
members.doc: Information about the order's buyer.

members.name: trackingInfo
members.doc: Tracking information.

members.name: fulfillmentStatus
members.doc:
The order's current fulfillment status.
One of:

 + `"NOT_FULFILLED"`: Order is not yet fulfilled.
 + `"FULFILLED"`: Order was fulfilled successfully.
 + `"CANCELED"`: Order was canceled.
 + `"PARTIALLY_FULFILLED"`: Order was partially fulfilled. For example, when only some of the order's items were fulfilled.

docs.summary: An object representing fulfillment information that was deleted.

body: // Place this code in the events.js file

members.name: orderId
members.doc: ID of the order the fulfillment was deleted from.

members.name: fulfillmentId
members.doc: ID of the fulfillment that was deleted.

members.name: fulfillmentStatus
members.doc:
The order's current fulfillment status.
One of:

 + `"NOT_FULFILLED"`: Order is not yet fulfilled.
 + `"FULFILLED"`: Order was fulfilled successfully.
 + `"CANCELED"`: Order was canceled.
 + `"PARTIALLY_FULFILLED"`: Order was partially fulfilled. For example, when only some of the order's items were fulfilled.

members.name: orderId
members.doc: The ID of the order, auto-generated when an order is created an unique within all Wix Stores.

members.name: number
members.doc: Running order number unique to the current store.

members.name: dateCreated
members.doc: The date the order was created.

members.name: buyerInfo
members.doc: The buyer's information.

members.name: currency
members.doc: The currency code for all of the order's prices.

members.name: weightUnit
members.doc: The order's units of weight. One of: `"KG"`, `"LB"`, or `"UNSPECIFIED_WEIGHT_UNIT"`.

members.name: totals
members.doc: The order's totals.

members.name: paymentStatus
members.doc: The order's payment status. One of: `"PAID"` or `"NOT_PAID"`.

members.name: fulfillmentStatus
members.doc: The order's fulfillment status. One of: `"FULFILLED"` or `"NOT_FULFILLED"`.

members.name: subscriptionInfo
members.doc:
Subscription information. Omitted unless the order is a subscription.
Learn more about [selling product subscriptions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-selling-product-subscriptions).

members.name: billingInfo
members.doc: Billinginformation.

docs.summary: An object representing the specific choices from the product's options.

examples.title: An event when a product variant information is updated
body: // Place this code in the events.js file

members.name: optionKey
members.doc:
Value of the option. This key name is
 dependent on the option changed in the product. For example, if a product
 has a size option, this key value will be something like "Size" and its value
 will be something like "Large".

 `optionKey` is not case-sensitive. Therefore the values for the option keys `"Size"` `"SIZE"` and `"size"` are combined.
